DELETE (FUN)
DELETE (FUN)
Â¶
FUNCTION DELETE : STRING(255)
Deletes a number of characters from a string
DELETE
(STR,
LEN,
POS)
means: Delete
LEN
characters from
STR
, beginning with the character in the
POS
position.
POS
=
0
or
POS
=
1
, are both addressing the first character.
Note
The current implementation is unfortunately not correct for the case
Pos=0
. The implementation cannot be changed for compatibility reasons.
If
Pos=0
is used, the parameter
LEN
is internally reduced by one!
It is generally recommended to use values in the range specified by IEC 61131-3. The smallest value for
Pos
is specified there as
1
.
(* Example declaration *)
VarSTRING1
:
STRING
;
(* Example in ST , result is 'SUSI' *)
VarSTRING1
:=
DELETE
(
'SUXYSI'
,
2
,
3
);
InOut:
Scope
Name
Type
Comment
Return
DELETE
STRING(255)
String remaining after deletion
Input
STR
STRING(255)
String to be modfied
LEN
INT
Length of the partial string to be deleted, number of
characters
POS
INT
Position in
STR
after which the deletion starts. Counted from left,
starting with 1
